title: AI Product Opportunities in 2023 for Software Engineers
Ask HN: Why do companies use terrible job application portals like Workday?
text: They are so bad, forcing you to create an account for every company and making you fill endless boxes to duplicate info on your resume. They probably lose 10-20% of good candidates through this funnel because it is so tedious to use. How did it become the standard ATS? Why aren't alternatives like Greenhouse or Lever more popular outside of startups?

Ask HN: Being Stalked by American Stasis
text:
Hi all. I know this will never get through this websites shitty spam filter design.

TLDR, been stalked everywhere I go by US funded terrorists (what I call US Stasis). Also known as cops and sheriffs.

It began 3 years ago when one night I randomly looked out of my home's window. Some new neighbors porch lights suddenly turned on and off. It kept happening any time I would peek and mind you my curtains were completely closed.

After this day I began noticing an absurd amount of pig.. cops wherever I would go.

These terrorists also began showing up to my place of work. Acting as regular customers but clearly using Stasi gaslighting tactics. Why? I have no clue.

They've also had cops live next to the apartment room of one of my family members. One day I randomly took a photo of their cop car in the parking lot and they disappeared from this location.

I can go on and on with the list but I'll wrap it up.

This government is completely corrupt and worse than Hitler's government. Prove me wrong.

Lastly I recently woke up with pain in my entire body and it has since subsided but this tells me these terrorists have damaged my DNA with their ionizing weapons.

I know they are using some form of X-ray weapon to see inside where I live. No I'm not a nut job. In fact I spend my free time reading about physics/quantum mechanics. I enjoy hearing Bach and Beethoven.

The original Stasis would use X-rays to induce cancer into their victims. I believe the same is true in my case as these terrorists are afraid of my speaking out against them.

Show HN: Group directories first with modified macOS `ls`
text:
I finally got tired of not having directories first on macOS, and something like exa <https://the.exa.website/> seemed overkill.

So I dug into the source code, hunted down the missing BSD-licensed headers, figured out how to work around the APSL headers (reverse engineering is documented in the comments in print.c), and smoothed out some rough edges.

Very much a personal itch-scratching exercise, but I think this is something that bugs a lot of people, so hopefully it's useful!

text:

I am in Hong Kong now. In a hotel. I know that I am being watched very closely.
